title: Kasimpur Baghel
text:
Kasimpur Baghel is a village in <a href="Rahi%2C%20Raebareli">Rahi</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 10 km from <a href="Rae%20Bareli">Rae Bareli</a>, the district headquarters. As of 2011, it has a population of 410 people, in 74 households. It has no schools and no healthcare facilities.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Kasimpur Baghel (as "Qasimpur Baghel") as comprising 2 hamlets, with a total population of 91 people (66 male and 25 female), in 24 households and 24 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 263 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Kasimpur Baghel (as "Kasimpur Bughel") as having a population of 208 people, in 39 households, and having an area of 106.03 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were given as wheat and rice.
